articles.headline: On an Old West Set, Trying to Create Hollywood’s Future
articles.snippet: Rideback Ranch is an attempt by one of the entertainment industry’s leading producers to find a new way to develop ideas for movies and TV shows.
articles.abstract: Rideback Ranch is an attempt by one of the entertainment industry’s leading producers to find a new way to develop ideas for movies and TV shows.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A gnarled buffalo hide hangs inside “the barn,” a cavernous room furnished with sofas and long tables. A secret passageway leads to an old-fashioned saloon where whiskey bottles line the wooden shelves and the bar stools are actual saddles. Antlers and antique rifles adorn the walls.

articles.headline: After Boeing Halts Max Production, Suppliers Wait for Fallout
articles.snippet: The decision made real what Boeing’s suppliers had dreaded — a suspension of unknown length that could force some of them to scale back production and even lay off workers.
articles.abstract: The decision made real what Boeing’s suppliers had dreaded — a suspension of unknown length that could force some of them to scale back production and even lay off workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boeing made a decision on Monday that the company had long resisted: to temporarily stop producing its most popular passenger jet, the 737 Max, which has been grounded for nine months in the wake of two crashes that killed 346 people.

articles.headline: Trump Impeached for Abuse of Power and Obstruction of Congress
articles.snippet: Voting nearly along party lines, the House approved two articles of impeachment against President Trump, making him the third president in history to face removal by the Senate.
articles.abstract: Voting nearly along party lines, the House approved two articles of impeachment against President Trump, making him the third president in history to face removal by the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House of Representatives on Wednesday impeached President Trump for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress, making him the third president in history to be charged with committing high crimes and misdemeanors and face removal by the Senate.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Uber Settles Federal Investigation Into Workplace Culture
articles.snippet: The ride-hailing company “permitted a culture of sexual harassment and retaliation,” the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission found.
articles.abstract: The ride-hailing company “permitted a culture of sexual harassment and retaliation,” the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission found.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In 2017, a former Uber employee wrote a public essay describing how the ride-hailing company had permitted sexual harassment to fester at the workplace.

articles.headline: Trump, Unbowed, Uses Rally to Strike Back Against Impeachment Vote
articles.snippet: The president traveled to Michigan, a vital electoral state, to deliver his response after he became the third president to be impeached by the House.
articles.abstract: The president traveled to Michigan, a vital electoral state, to deliver his response after he became the third president to be impeached by the House.
articles.lead_paragraph: BATTLE CREEK, Mich. — President Trump angrily responded to the impeachment he had long been dreading on Wednesday, lashing out at his Democratic accusers in a rambling two-hour speech and calling for their defeat in November.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley, Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Impeachment Day in Washington: History Emerges From the Routine Chaos
articles.snippet: From Capitol Hill to the Trump hotel to the White House, Wednesday was not a normal day, even in the not-normal Trump administration.
articles.abstract: From Capitol Hill to the Trump hotel to the White House, Wednesday was not a normal day, even in the not-normal Trump administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It’s not as if anyone was expecting a normal Wednesday to materialize on Capitol Hill. Presidents don’t get impeached every day, just like they generally don’t write six-page harangues charging Democrats with “declaring open war on American Democracy”(that was Tuesday) or tweet that Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s “teeth were falling out of her mouth” (that was Sunday).
articles.byline: By Mark Leibovich and Katie Rogers

articles.headline: A President Impeached, and a Nation Convulsed
articles.snippet: The impeachment battles over Andrew Johnson, Richard M. Nixon and Bill Clinton came at turning points in the American story. The time that produced President Trump has proved to be another one.
articles.abstract: The impeachment battles over Andrew Johnson, Richard M. Nixon and Bill Clinton came at turning points in the American story. The time that produced President Trump has proved to be another one.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For the most unpredictable of presidents, it was the most predictable of outcomes. Is anyone really surprised that President Trump was impeached? His defiant disregard for red lines arguably made him an impeachment waiting to happen.

articles.headline: Goldman Is in Talks to Settle Malaysia Fund Scandal
articles.snippet: A settlement with federal prosecutors could be reached by the end of next month.
articles.abstract: A settlement with federal prosecutors could be reached by the end of next month.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs is negotiating with federal prosecutors to pay a fine of as much as $2 billion, and have a subsidiary plead guilty to settle claims about its role in a scheme to loot billions from a sovereign wealth fund in Malaysia, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.
articles.byline: By Emily Flitter and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Trump Impeachment Trial in Doubt as Democrats Weigh Withholding Articles
articles.snippet: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she would wait to see what the trial in the Senate would look like before sending the two charges there.
articles.abstract: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she would wait to see what the trial in the Senate would look like before sending the two charges there.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The day after the House cast historic votes to impeach President Trump, Speaker Nancy Pelosi put an abrupt halt on the proceedings, holding back from sending the charges to the Republican-led Senate in a politically risky bid to exert influence over the contours of an election-year trial.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Where Are the Tech Zillionaires? San Francisco Faces the I.P.O. Fizzle
articles.snippet: All those tech I.P.O.s this year that were supposed to make people megarich only made them rich-ish.
articles.abstract: All those tech I.P.O.s this year that were supposed to make people megarich only made them rich-ish.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Seven months ago, the Four Seasons in San Francisco sent out a news release announcing the glad tidings that would come soon: New residences for the new money.
articles.byline: By Nellie Bowles and Kate Conger

articles.headline: Democrats Love Free College, Until You Offer Them More Options
articles.snippet: A new survey finds that Democrats haven’t fully embraced progressive policy proposals like free college and Medicare for all.
articles.abstract: A new survey finds that Democrats haven’t fully embraced progressive policy proposals like free college and Medicare for all.
articles.lead_paragraph: Progressive policy ideas have dominated the early stages of the Democratic primary campaign. But as candidates gather in Los Angeles for another debate on Thursday evening, Democratic voters may be seeking more moderate options.
